cbccore.movement
Class DriveTrain

java.lang.Object
  cbccore.movement.DriveTrain

public class DriveTrain
extends java.lang.Object

A pluggable movement library. Fill in a few low-level fields by extending the abstract MovementPlugin class, and this class will do the rest. You can extend this class to more advanced things, and thanks to the pluggable architecture, people will be able to use your version with their own plugins.

Author:
Benjamin Woodruff, Grady Bryson
See Also:
cbccore.movement.plugins, MovementPlugin

rotateDegrees

public void rotateDegrees(double degrees,
                          double degreesPerSecond)
Rotates the device a specified number of degrees Counter-Clockwise

Parameters:
degrees - The desired change in degrees
See Also:
rotateRadians(double, double)

rotateRadians

public void rotateRadians(double radians,
                          double radiansPerSecond)
Rotates the device a specified number of radians Counter-Clockwise

Parameters:
radians - The desired change in radians
radiansPerSecond - The number of radians to rotate every second
See Also:
rotateDegrees(double, double)

moveCurveDegrees

public void moveCurveDegrees(double degrees,
                             double radius,
                             double cmps)
Moves the robot in a piece of a circle.

Parameters:
radians - The piece of the circle defined as a change in the robot's rotation in radians. If degrees, the robot will move backwards around the circle, otherwise positive.
radius - The radius of the circle. If negative, the robot will move in a CW circle, otherwise a CCW one.
cmps - The Centimeters-Per-Second of the center of the robot. The maximum value for this is less than maxCmps
See Also:
moveCurveRadians(double, double, double)

moveCurveRadians

public void moveCurveRadians(double radians,
                             double radius,
                             double cmps)
Moves the robot in a piece of a circle.

Parameters:
radians - The piece of the circle defined as a change in the robot's rotation in radians. If negative, the robot will move backwards around the circle, otherwise positive.
radius - The radius of the circle. If negative, the robot will move in a CW circle, otherwise a CCW one.
cmps - The Centimeters-Per-Second of the center of the robot. The maximum value for this is less than maxCmps
See Also:
moveCurveDegrees(double, double, double)

moveCm

public void moveCm(double cm,
                   double cmps)
Moves robot forward a certain number of centimeters at a set speed. If you specify a negitive number for cm, the robot will move backwards that many centimeters.

Parameters:
cm - Desired distance in centimeters
cmps - Desired speed in centimeters-per-second

moveParser

protected static double moveParser(double cm,
                                   double cmps)
Utility to make cmps match the sign of cm.

moveWheelCm

protected void moveWheelCm(double leftCm,
                           double rightCm,
                           double leftCmps,
                           double rightCmps)

directDrive

public void directDrive(double leftCmps,
                        double rightCmps)
Can be used to manually control the speed of each drive wheel. Every movement call eventually gets run through here, so if one wanted to make a fundamental change to the movement, this or moveWheelCm would be the methods to override.

Parameters:
leftCmps - The desired speed of the left wheel in centimeters-per-second
rightCmps - The desired speed of the right wheel in centimeters-per-second

getPosition

public DriveTrainPosition getPosition()
Solves for the specific position of the robot at this moment in time. Adapted from here.

updateOldPos

protected void updateOldPos()
Read this.

moveAtCmps

public void moveAtCmps(double cmps)
It's always handy to have a method like this. Just moves the robot at a set speed, so say you wanted to back into some PVC to line yourself up, this could help.

Parameters:
cmps - The speed for the robot to move in centimeters-per-second
See Also:
directDrive(double, double)

stop

public void stop()
Just mirrors (calls) freeze()

See Also:
freeze(), kill(), MovementPlugin.stop()

freeze

public void freeze()
Will lock both the robot's motors if possible, otherwise it will call kill()

See Also:
stop(), kill(), MovementPlugin.freeze()

kill

public void kill()
Stops the robot by setting the speed to zero, or with whatever other mechanism that is defined by the MovementPlugin.

See Also:
stop(), freeze(), MovementPlugin.kill()

public double getMaxCmps()
Gets the maximum linear speed in centimeters-per-second for the robot.

Returns:
The maximum speed in centimeters-per-second for the robot.
